post.body: So how's the stomach today?
You won't be quite as sentimental when that tooth latches onto your finger. Voice of experience :)
I'm thinking Don't Stop Believin'. Maybe Separate Ways. faithfully could be fun too.
Possibly.
Not when they're supposed to be in bed sleeping.
Definitely in the top 5, to be sure. Welcome aboard!
Is that Persona 4 game English-friendly? It looks very interesting, but I speak no Japanese.
♫ We're off to the witch, we may never never never come home, but the magic that we'll feel is worth a lifetime... ♫
Ooh, Dio on the tv now. A bit of The Last In Line, and then I attempt a recording. And someday, @zaldor, you know it'll happen...
Also: my daughter doesn't want me singing in public because it embarrasses her. But it was Peter Gabriel on the mall muzak! How could I stop
(But first, another delicious homemade turkey sandwich!)
Listening to Journey on the tv music stations. There's a lot of Journey songs on singsnap. Stand by for karaoke!
Returned from Sam's Club. Turkey crossaint sammiches for lunch. After that, try to find Rock Band and test the $10 guitar we picked up.
That'll do it for me. Night, kids.
It's after midnight, and the kids are still bopping in and out of the bathroom. They're gonna have trouble come Monday.
No phishing attempts here. But then again, I haven't been watching all day, and may have missed one.
Wow, this Iron Chef America is turning out tasty looking. Secret ingredient - suckling pig. Kind of a cheat, since that's lots of options.
Re: Persona 4. Apparently it is English-frendy. Looks cool. http://www.atlus.com/persona4/media.html http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persona_4
RT @lots "WARNING! There's a phishing scam running rampant on Twitter: http://tinyurl.com/9rmfy6" - just to pass it along
Cadbury eggs are out already!time to stock up.
